   430→
   431→## Full CRUD Implementation (REQUIRED for Every App!)
   432→
   433→**⚠️ CRITICAL: Every app in the dashboard MUST have full CRUD operations.**
   434→
   435→The design_brief.md specifies CRUD operations for each app. You MUST implement ALL of them - Create, Read, Update, Delete - for EVERY app. No exceptions.
   436→
   437→### CRUD Architecture Pattern
   438→
   439→For each app, implement these components:
   440→
   441→1. **List/Table View** - Shows all records (Read)
   442→2. **Create/Edit Dialog** - Shared dialog for creating and editing (Create + Update)
   443→3. **Delete Confirmation Dialog** - Confirmation before deleting (Delete)
   444→4. **Data refresh** - After any mutation, refresh the data
   445→
   446→### Reusable CRUD Dialog Pattern
   447→
   448→Use a SINGLE dialog component for both Create and Edit per app:
   449→
   450→```typescript
   451→import { useState } from 'react';
   452→import { Dialog, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogFooter } from '@/components/ui/dialog';
   453→import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
   454→import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input';
   455→import { Label } from '@/components/ui/label';
   456→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   457→import { toast } from '@/components/ui/use-toast';
   458→
   459→interface RecordDialogProps {
   460→  open: boolean;
   461→  onOpenChange: (open: boolean) => void;
   462→  record?: MyAppRecord | null;  // null = Create mode, record = Edit mode
   463→  onSuccess: () => void;
   464→}
   465→
   466→function MyAppRecordDialog({ open, onOpenChange, record, onSuccess }: RecordDialogProps) {
   467→  const isEditing = !!record;
   468→  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false);
   469→  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
   470→    name: record?.fields.name ?? '',
   471→    value: record?.fields.value ?? 0,
   472→    // ... all fields with defaults
   473→  });
   474→
   475→  // Reset form when dialog opens with different record
   476→  useEffect(() => {
   477→    if (open) {
   478→      setFormData({
   479→        name: record?.fields.name ?? '',
   480→        value: record?.fields.value ?? 0,
   481→      });
   482→    }
   483→  }, [open, record]);
   484→
   485→  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent) {
   486→    e.preventDefault();
   487→    setSubmitting(true);
   488→
   489→    try {
   490→      if (isEditing) {
   491→        await LivingAppsService.updateMyAppRecord(record!.record_id, formData);
   492→        toast({ title: 'Gespeichert', description: 'Eintrag wurde aktualisiert.' });
   493→      } else {
   494→        await LivingAppsService.createMyAppRecord(formData);
   495→        toast({ title: 'Erstellt', description: 'Neuer Eintrag wurde erstellt.' });
   496→      }
   497→      onOpenChange(false);
   498→      onSuccess();  // ← Triggers data refresh
   499→    } catch (err) {
   500→      toast({
   501→        title: 'Fehler',
   502→        description: `Fehler beim ${isEditing ? 'Speichern' : 'Erstellen'}: ${err instanceof Error ? err.message : 'Unbekannter Fehler'}`,
   503→        variant: 'destructive',
   504→      });
   505→    } finally {
   506→      setSubmitting(false);
   507→    }
   508→  }
   509→
   510→  return (
   511→    <Dialog open={open} onOpenChange={onOpenChange}>
   512→      <DialogContent className="sm:max-w-md">
   513→        <DialogHeader>
   514→          <DialogTitle>{isEditing ? 'Eintrag bearbeiten' : 'Neuer Eintrag'}</DialogTitle>
   515→        </DialogHeader>
   516→        <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-4">
   517→          <div className="space-y-2">
   518→            <Label htmlFor="name">Name</Label>
   519→            <Input
   520→              id="name"
   521→              value={formData.name}
   522→              onChange={(e) => setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, name: e.target.value }))}
   523→              required
   524→            />
   525→          </div>
   526→          {/* ... more fields ... */}
   527→          <DialogFooter>
   528→            <Button type="button" variant="outline" onClick={() => onOpenChange(false)}>
   529→              Abbrechen
   530→            </Button>
   531→            <Button type="submit" disabled={submitting}>
   532→              {submitting ? 'Speichert...' : (isEditing ? 'Speichern' : 'Erstellen')}
   533→            </Button>
   534→          </DialogFooter>
   535→        </form>
   536→      </DialogContent>
   537→    </Dialog>
   538→  );
   539→}
   540→```
   541→
   542→### Delete Confirmation Pattern
   543→
   544→**ALWAYS require confirmation before deleting!**
   545→
   546→```typescript
   547→import {
   548→  AlertDialog,
   549→  AlertDialogAction,
   550→  AlertDialogCancel,
   551→  AlertDialogContent,
   552→  AlertDialogDescription,
   553→  AlertDialogFooter,
   554→  AlertDialogHeader,
   555→  AlertDialogTitle,
   556→} from '@/components/ui/alert-dialog';
   557→
   558→interface DeleteDialogProps {
   559→  open: boolean;
   560→  onOpenChange: (open: boolean) => void;
   561→  recordName: string;  // What is being deleted (for display)
   562→  onConfirm: () => Promise<void>;
   563→}
   564→
   565→function DeleteConfirmDialog({ open, onOpenChange, recordName, onConfirm }: DeleteDialogProps) {
   566→  const [deleting, setDeleting] = useState(false);
   567→
   568→  async function handleDelete() {
   569→    setDeleting(true);
   570→    try {
   571→      await onConfirm();
   572→      toast({ title: 'Gelöscht', description: `"${recordName}" wurde gelöscht.` });
   573→      onOpenChange(false);
   574→    } catch (err) {
   575→      toast({
   576→        title: 'Fehler',
   577→        description: 'Eintrag konnte nicht gelöscht werden.',
   578→        variant: 'destructive',
   579→      });
   580→    } finally {
   581→      setDeleting(false);
   582→    }
   583→  }
   584→
   585→  return (
   586→    <AlertDialog open={open} onOpenChange={onOpenChange}>
   587→      <AlertDialogContent>
   588→        <AlertDialogHeader>
   589→          <AlertDialogTitle>Eintrag löschen?</AlertDialogTitle>
   590→          <AlertDialogDescription>
   591→            Möchtest du "{recordName}" wirklich löschen? Diese Aktion kann nicht rückgängig gemacht werden.
   592→          </AlertDialogDescription>
   593→        </AlertDialogHeader>
   594→        <AlertDialogFooter>
   595→          <AlertDialogCancel>Abbrechen</AlertDialogCancel>
   596→          <AlertDialogAction
   597→            onClick={handleDelete}
   598→            disabled={deleting}
   599→            className="bg-destructive text-destructive-foreground hover:bg-destructive/90"
   600→          >
   601→            {deleting ? 'Löscht...' : 'Löschen'}
   602→          </AlertDialogAction>
   603→        </AlertDialogFooter>
   604→      </AlertDialogContent>
   605→    </AlertDialog>
   606→  );
   607→}
   608→```
   609→
   610→### CRUD List with Edit/Delete Actions
   611→
   612→```typescript
   613→import { Pencil, Trash2, Plus } from 'lucide-react';
   614→
   615→function MyAppList() {
   616→  const [records, setRecords] = useState<MyAppRecord[]>([]);
   617→  const [editRecord, setEditRecord] = useState<MyAppRecord | null>(null);
   618→  const [deleteRecord, setDeleteRecord] = useState<MyAppRecord | null>(null);
   619→  const [showCreateDialog, setShowCreateDialog] = useState(false);
   620→
   621→  async function refreshData() {
   622→    const data = await LivingAppsService.getMyAppRecords();
   623→    setRecords(data);
   624→  }
   625→
   626→  async function handleDelete() {
   627→    if (!deleteRecord) return;
   628→    await LivingAppsService.deleteMyAppRecord(deleteRecord.record_id);
   629→    setDeleteRecord(null);
   630→    refreshData();
   631→  }
   632→
   633→  return (
   634→    <>
   635→      {/* Header with Create button */}
   636→      <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-4">
   637→        <h2 className="text-lg font-semibold">Meine Einträge</h2>
   638→        <Button size="sm" onClick={() => setShowCreateDialog(true)}>
   639→          <Plus className="h-4 w-4 mr-1" /> Neu
   640→        </Button>
   641→      </div>
   642→
   643→      {/* Record list with inline edit/delete actions */}
   644→      {records.map((record) => (
   645→        <div key={record.record_id} className="flex items-center justify-between p-3 rounded-lg border">
   646→          <div>
   647→            <div className="font-medium">{record.fields.name}</div>
   648→            <div className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">{record.fields.description}</div>
   649→          </div>
   650→          <div className="flex gap-1">
   651→            <Button
   652→              variant="ghost"
   653→              size="icon"
   654→              onClick={() => setEditRecord(record)}
   655→              aria-label="Bearbeiten"
   656→            >
   657→              <Pencil className="h-4 w-4" />
   658→            </Button>
   659→            <Button
   660→              variant="ghost"
   661→              size="icon"
   662→              onClick={() => setDeleteRecord(record)}
   663→              aria-label="Löschen"
   664→              className="text-destructive hover:text-destructive"
   665→            >
   666→              <Trash2 className="h-4 w-4" />
   667→            </Button>
   668→          </div>
   669→        </div>
   670→      ))}
   671→
   672→      {/* Create Dialog (record=null → create mode) */}
   673→      <MyAppRecordDialog
   674→        open={showCreateDialog}
   675→        onOpenChange={setShowCreateDialog}
   676→        record={null}
   677→        onSuccess={refreshData}
   678→      />
   679→
   680→      {/* Edit Dialog (record=editRecord → edit mode) */}
   681→      <MyAppRecordDialog
   682→        open={!!editRecord}
   683→        onOpenChange={(open) => !open && setEditRecord(null)}
   684→        record={editRecord}
   685→        onSuccess={refreshData}
   686→      />
   687→
   688→      {/* Delete Confirmation */}
   689→      <DeleteConfirmDialog
   690→        open={!!deleteRecord}
   691→        onOpenChange={(open) => !open && setDeleteRecord(null)}
   692→        recordName={deleteRecord?.fields.name ?? ''}
   693→        onConfirm={handleDelete}
   694→      />
   695→    </>
   696→  );
   697→}
   698→```
   699→
   700→### CRUD Service Methods Pattern
   701→
   702→The generated `livingAppsService.ts` already includes GET and CREATE. You MUST also use UPDATE and DELETE:
   703→
   704→```typescript
   705→// These methods should already exist in livingAppsService.ts:
   706→
   707→// GET all records
   708→static async getMyAppRecords(): Promise<MyAppRecord[]> { ... }
   709→
   710→// CREATE a record
   711→static async createMyAppRecord(data: Partial<MyAppFields>): Promise<any> {
   712→  return this.request(`/apps/${APP_IDS.MY_APP}/records`, {
   713→    method: 'POST',
   714→    body: JSON.stringify(data),
   715→  });
   716→}
   717→
   718→// UPDATE a record (PATCH - only changed fields)
   719→static async updateMyAppRecord(recordId: string, data: Partial<MyAppFields>): Promise<any> {
   720→  return this.request(`/apps/${APP_IDS.MY_APP}/records/${recordId}`, {
   721→    method: 'PATCH',
   722→    body: JSON.stringify(data),
   723→  });
   724→}
   725→
   726→// DELETE a record
   727→static async deleteMyAppRecord(recordId: string): Promise<any> {
   728→  return this.request(`/apps/${APP_IDS.MY_APP}/records/${recordId}`, {
   729→    method: 'DELETE',
   730→  });
   731→}
   732→```
   733→
   734→**⚠️ If `livingAppsService.ts` is missing update/delete methods, you MUST add them!**
   735→
   736→### CRUD Implementation Checklist
   737→
   738→For EVERY app in `app_metadata.json`, verify:
   739→- [ ] **Create** - Users can create new records via dialog/form
   740→- [ ] **Read** - Records are displayed in a list/table with all relevant fields
   741→- [ ] **Update** - Users can edit existing records (same form as create, pre-filled)
   742→- [ ] **Delete** - Users can delete records with confirmation dialog
   743→- [ ] **Feedback** - Toast messages for success and error on every operation
   744→- [ ] **Refresh** - Data refreshes after every mutation
   745→- [ ] **Loading states** - Submit buttons show loading state during operations
   746→- [ ] **Error handling** - Failed operations show error message, don't lose user input
   747→

   749→
   750→## React Router Navigation (REQUIRED!)
   751→
   752→**⚠️ CRITICAL: The dashboard MUST use React Router for navigation between apps.**
   753→
   754→Each app gets its own route/page. Do NOT build a single scrollable page with all apps crammed together.
   755→
   756→### Step 1: Install React Router (if not already)
   757→
   758→```bash
   759→npm install react-router-dom
   760→```
   761→
   762→### Step 2: Set Up Router in main.tsx
   763→
   764→```typescript
   765→import { BrowserRouter } from 'react-router-dom';
   766→
   767→ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('root')!).render(
   768→  <React.StrictMode>
   769→    <BrowserRouter basename={import.meta.env.BASE_URL}>
   770→      <App />
   771→    </BrowserRouter>
   772→  </React.StrictMode>
   773→);
   774→```
   775→
   776→**⚠️ CRITICAL: Always use `basename={import.meta.env.BASE_URL}`!** The dashboard is deployed to GitHub Pages under a subpath (e.g. `/repo-name/`). Without basename, all routes will break in production.
   777→
   778→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Reverse Proxy Base Path (my.living-apps.de)
   779→
   780→The dashboard is deployed to GitHub Pages but accessed through a **reverse proxy** at:
   781→```
   782→https://my.living-apps.de/github/<repo-name>/
   783→```
   784→
   785→The reverse proxy adds `/github/` to the path. The `base` in `vite.config.ts` **MUST match the actual URL path** where users access the site, not just the GitHub Pages path.
   786→
   787→**How it works:**
   788→1. GitHub Pages serves files at: `https://<user>.github.io/<repo-name>/`
   789→2. Reverse proxy maps: `my.living-apps.de/github/<repo-name>/` → `<user>.github.io/<repo-name>/`
   790→3. Users access: `https://my.living-apps.de/github/<repo-name>/`
   791→4. Browser sees URL path: `/github/<repo-name>/`
   792→
   793→**Therefore `vite.config.ts` must use:**
   794→```typescript
   795→export default defineConfig({
   796→  base: '/github/<repo-name>/',  // ✅ Matches the actual URL path via reverse proxy
   797→  // NOT: base: '/<repo-name>/',  // ❌ Only matches direct GitHub Pages URL
   798→});
   799→```
   800→
   801→**Why this matters:**
   802→- `import.meta.env.BASE_URL` returns the value of `base` from vite.config.ts
   803→- This is used as `<BrowserRouter basename={import.meta.env.BASE_URL}>`
   804→- If `basename` doesn't match the actual URL path, React Router **renders nothing** and shows:
   805→  ```
   806→  <Router basename="/repo/"> is not able to match the URL "/github/repo/"
   807→  ```
   808→- Asset paths (`<script>`, `<link>`) also use `base`, so they must match the proxy path
   809→
   810→**Bonus: CORS resolved automatically!**
   811→When the site is served from `my.living-apps.de` (same domain as the API), API calls to `https://my.living-apps.de/rest/...` are **same-origin** — no CORS issues. This only works when users access via the reverse proxy, not via direct GitHub Pages URL.
   812→
   813→### Step 3: Define Routes in App.tsx
   814→
   815→```typescript
   816→import { Routes, Route } from 'react-router-dom';
   817→import { Layout } from '@/components/Layout';
   818→import { DashboardOverview } from '@/pages/DashboardOverview';
   819→import { WorkoutsPage } from '@/pages/WorkoutsPage';
   820→import { ExercisesPage } from '@/pages/ExercisesPage';
   821→// ... import a page for each app
   822→
   823→function App() {
   824→  return (
   825→    <Layout>
   826→      <Routes>
   827→        <Route path="/" element={<DashboardOverview />} />
   828→        <Route path="/workouts" element={<WorkoutsPage />} />
   829→        <Route path="/exercises" element={<ExercisesPage />} />
   830→        {/* One route per app */}
   831→      </Routes>
   832→    </Layout>
   833→  );
   834→}
   835→```
   836→
   837→### Step 4: Create Layout with Navigation
   838→
   839→The Layout component wraps all pages and provides navigation.
   840→
   841→```typescript
   842→import { NavLink, useLocation } from 'react-router-dom';
   843→import { Home, Dumbbell, ListChecks } from 'lucide-react';
   844→import { cn } from '@/lib/utils';
   845→
   846→const NAV_ITEMS = [

   852→
   853→function Layout({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {

   857→      <aside className="hidden md:flex md:w-64 md:flex-col md:fixed md:inset-y-0 border-r bg-card">

   860→        </div>
   861→        <nav className="flex-1 px-3 space-y-1">
   862→          {NAV_ITEMS.map((item) => (
   863→            <NavLink
   864→              key={item.path}
   865→              to={item.path}
   866→              className={({ isActive }) =>
   867→                cn(
   868→                  'flex items-center gap-3 px-3 py-2 rounded-lg text-sm font-medium transition-colors',
   869→                  isActive

   875→              <item.icon className="h-5 w-5" />
   876→              {item.label}
   877→            </NavLink>
   878→          ))}
   879→        </nav>
   880→      </aside>
   881→
   882→      {/* Main content area */}
   883→      <main className="md:pl-64">
   884→        <div className="p-4 md:p-8 max-w-7xl mx-auto">
   885→          {children}
   886→        </div>
   887→      </main>
   888→
   889→      {/* Mobile: Bottom tab navigation */}
   890→      <nav className="md:hidden fixed bottom-0 left-0 right-0 border-t bg-card z-50">
   891→        <div className="flex justify-around">
   892→          {NAV_ITEMS.map((item) => (
   893→            <NavLink
   894→              key={item.path}
   895→              to={item.path}
   896→              className={({ isActive }) =>
   897→                cn(
   898→                  'flex flex-col items-center gap-1 py-2 px-3 text-xs font-medium transition-colors',
   899→                  isActive ? 'text-primary' : 'text-muted-foreground'
   900→                )
   901→              }
   902→            >
   903→              <item.icon className="h-5 w-5" />
   904→              {item.label}
   905→            </NavLink>
   906→          ))}
   907→        </div>

   913→
   914→### Step 5: Create a Page Per App
   915→
   916→Each app page contains the full CRUD view for that app:
   917→
   918→```typescript
   919→// src/pages/WorkoutsPage.tsx
   920→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
   921→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
   922→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
   923→
   924→export function WorkoutsPage() {
   925→  const [records, setRecords] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
   926→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
   927→
   928→  async function refreshData() {
   929→    setLoading(true);
   930→    const data = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
   931→    setRecords(data);
   932→    setLoading(false);
   933→  }
   934→
   935→  useEffect(() => { refreshData(); }, []);
   936→
   937→  // Full CRUD UI: list, create dialog, edit dialog, delete confirmation
   938→  return (
   939→    <div>
   940→      <div className="flex items-center justify-between mb-6">
   941→        <h1 className="text-2xl font-bold">Workouts</h1>
   942→        <Button onClick={() => setShowCreate(true)}>
   943→          <Plus className="h-4 w-4 mr-2" /> Neues Workout
   944→        </Button>
   945→      </div>
   946→      {/* Record list with edit/delete actions */}
   947→      {/* Create/Edit Dialog */}
   948→      {/* Delete Confirmation */}
   949→    </div>
   950→  );
   951→}
   952→```
   953→
   954→### Step 6: Dashboard Overview Page
   955→
   956→The root route (`/`) shows a summary across all apps:
   957→
   958→```typescript
   959→// src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx
   960→export function DashboardOverview() {
   961→  // Fetch data from ALL apps for KPIs
   962→  // Show hero KPI, secondary KPIs, charts
   963→  // Quick action buttons that navigate to app pages
   964→  // Recent activity across all apps
   965→}
   966→```
   967→
   968→### File Structure
   969→
   970→Organize pages and components cleanly:
   971→
   972→```
   973→src/
   974→├── main.tsx                    # BrowserRouter setup
   975→├── App.tsx                     # Routes definition
   976→├── components/
   977→│   ├── Layout.tsx              # Navigation layout (sidebar + bottom tabs)
   978→│   ├── ui/                     # shadcn components
   979→│   └── shared/                 # Shared components (DeleteDialog, etc.)
   980→├── pages/
   981→│   ├── DashboardOverview.tsx   # / route - summary across all apps
   982→│   ├── WorkoutsPage.tsx        # /workouts - full CRUD for Workouts app
   983→│   ├── ExercisesPage.tsx       # /exercises - full CRUD for Exercises app
   984→│   └── ...                     # One page per app
   985→├── services/
   986→│   └── livingAppsService.ts    # API service (generated)
   987→└── types/
   988→    └── app.ts                  # TypeScript types (generated)
   989→```
   990→
   991→### Navigation Rules
   992→
   993→1. **Use `NavLink`, not `Link`** - NavLink provides `isActive` for styling
   994→2. **Always use `basename`** - Required for GitHub Pages deployment
   995→3. **Mobile: max 5 bottom tabs** - If more apps, use a "More" tab or hamburger menu
   996→4. **Desktop: sidebar always visible** - Shows all apps with icons and labels
   997→5. **Active route highlighted** - Follow design_brief.md for exact styling
   998→6. **Page title** - Each page should have a clear `<h1>` title
   999→
  1000→### React Router Checklist
  1001→
  1002→- [ ] `react-router-dom` installed
  1003→- [ ] `BrowserRouter` with `basename` in main.tsx
  1004→- [ ] Routes defined for every app in App.tsx
  1005→- [ ] Layout component with sidebar (desktop) + bottom tabs (mobile)
  1006→- [ ] `NavLink` used with active state styling
  1007→- [ ] Dashboard Overview page at `/` with summary KPIs
  1008→- [ ] One page per app with full CRUD
  1009→- [ ] Mobile bottom tabs don't overlap content (add `pb-16` to main content)
  1010→- [ ] Navigation matches design_brief.md Section 7
  1011→
  1012→---
  1013→
  1014→## Drill-Down: When and How to Use It
  1015→
  1016→Drill-down is useful when there's **more information to show** than fits in the summary view. Don't add it everywhere - only where it adds value.
  1017→
  1018→### When to Use Drill-Down
  1019→
  1020→| Good Use Cases | Skip Drill-Down When... |
  1021→|----------------|------------------------|
  1022→| List item → show full record details | The summary already shows everything |
  1023→| Summary count → show the items being counted | It's a simple, self-explanatory number |
  1024→| Record reference → view the related record | There's no additional detail to show |
  1025→
  1026→### Make It Obvious
  1027→
  1028→If something is clickable, make it visually clear:
  1029→- Hover effect (shadow, background change)
  1030→- Cursor pointer
  1031→- Underline or chevron icon for "see more"
  1032→
  1033→### Implementation Pattern: Clickable List Item
  1034→
  1035→```typescript
  1036→// Use when list items have more details to show
  1037→<div
  1038→  className="p-3 rounded-lg hover:bg-muted cursor-pointer transition-colors"
  1039→  onClick={() => setSelectedRecord(record)}
  1040→>
  1041→  <div className="font-medium">{record.name}</div>
  1042→  <div className="text-sm text-muted-foreground">{record.summary}</div>
  1043→</div>
  1044→```
  1045→
  1046→**Don't force drill-down everywhere.** A simple KPI that shows "5 workouts this week" doesn't need a click handler if there's nothing more to show.
  1047→
  1048→---

  1056→}

  1067→    />

  1071→
  1072→### Error States
  1073→```typescript
  1074→if (error) {
  1075→  return (
  1076→    <Alert variant="destructive">

  1105→---
  1106→
  1107→# Living Apps API Reference
  1108→
  1109→## ⚠️ Critical API Rules
  1110→
  1111→These rules are **non-negotiable**. Breaking them causes runtime errors.
  1112→
  1113→---
  1114→
  1115→## 1. Date Formats
  1116→
  1117→Living Apps has strict date format requirements:
  1118→
  1119→| Field Type | Format | Example |
  1120→|------------|--------|---------|
  1121→| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |
  1122→| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
  1123→
  1124→### ❌ WRONG
  1125→```typescript
  1126→// Seconds are NOT allowed for datetimeminute!
  1127→const date = '2025-11-06T12:00:00';  // ❌ Will fail
  1128→```
  1129→
  1130→### ✅ CORRECT
  1131→```typescript
  1132→// For date/datetimeminute fields
  1133→const dateForAPI = formData.datum + 'T12:00';  // ✅ YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM
  1134→
  1135→// For date/date fields
  1136→const dateForAPI = formData.datum;  // ✅ YYYY-MM-DD
  1137→
  1138→// Display in <input type="date">
  1139→const dateForInput = apiData.datum?.split('T')[0];  // Extract YYYY-MM-DD
  1140→```
  1141→
  1142→---
  1143→
  1144→## 2. applookup Fields
  1145→
  1146→`applookup/select` fields store **full URLs** to related records.
  1147→
  1148→### URL Format
  1149→```
  1150→https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1151→```
  1152→
  1153→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Always use extractRecordId()
  1154→
  1155→```typescript
  1156→// ❌ NEVER do this manually
  1157→const parts = url.split('/');
  1158→const id = parts[parts.length - 1];  // ❌ Fragile!
  1159→
  1160→// ✅ ALWAYS use the helper function
  1161→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1162→
  1163→const recordId = extractRecordId(url);
  1164→if (!recordId) return;  // ✅ Always null-check!
  1165→```
  1166→
  1167→### extractRecordId() Implementation
  1168→```typescript
  1169→export function extractRecordId(url: string | null | undefined): string | null {
  1170→  if (!url) return null;
  1171→  // Extracts last 24 hex characters (Living Apps Record IDs)
  1172→  const match = url.match(/([a-f0-9]{24})$/i);
  1173→  return match ? match[1] : null;
  1174→}
  1175→```
  1176→
  1177→### Creating applookup Values
  1178→```typescript
  1179→import { createRecordUrl, APP_IDS } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1180→
  1181→// When creating/updating records with applookup fields
  1182→const data = {
  1183→  kategorie: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.KATEGORIEN, selectedKategorieId),
  1184→};
  1185→
  1186→// createRecordUrl returns:
  1187→// 'https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}'
  1188→```
  1189→
  1190→### applookup Can Be Null!
  1191→```typescript
  1192→// ❌ WRONG - Will crash if field is null
  1193→workoutLogs.forEach((log) => {
  1194→  const id = extractRecordId(log.fields.uebung);
  1195→  data[id] = log;  // ❌ Crashes if id is null
  1196→});
  1197→
  1198→// ✅ CORRECT - Defensive programming
  1199→workoutLogs.forEach((log) => {
  1200→  const id = extractRecordId(log.fields.uebung);
  1201→  if (!id) return;  // ✅ Skip if null
  1202→  if (!data[id]) data[id] = [];
  1203→  data[id].push(log);
  1204→});
  1205→```
  1206→
  1207→---
  1208→
  1209→## 3. API Response Format
  1210→
  1211→Living Apps returns **objects**, not arrays!
  1212→
  1213→### Response Structure
  1214→```typescript
  1215→// API returns:
  1216→{
  1217→  "690abc123...": {
  1218→    "createdat": "2025-11-06T10:00:00",
  1219→    "updatedat": null,
  1220→    "fields": {
  1221→      "name": "Item 1",
  1222→      "value": 100
  1223→    }
  1224→  },
  1225→  "690def456...": {
  1226→    "createdat": "2025-11-06T11:00:00",
  1227→    "updatedat": null,
  1228→    "fields": {
  1229→      "name": "Item 2",
  1230→      "value": 200
  1231→    }
  1232→  }
  1233→}
  1234→```
  1235→
  1236→### ❌ WRONG Transformation
  1237→```typescript
  1238→// Loses record_id!
  1239→const items = Object.values(response);  // ❌ No record_id!
  1240→```
  1241→
  1242→### ✅ CORRECT Transformation
  1243→```typescript
  1244→// Use Object.entries() to preserve record_id
  1245→const items = Object.entries(response).map(([record_id, record]) => ({
  1246→  record_id,  // ← From the key
  1247→  createdat: record.createdat,
  1248→  updatedat: record.updatedat,
  1249→  ...record.fields,
  1250→}));
  1251→```
  1252→
  1253→### Why record_id Matters
  1254→- Required for React `key` prop
  1255→- Required for update/delete operations
  1256→- Required for applookup references
  1257→
  1258→---
  1259→
  1260→## 4. API Authentication
  1261→
  1262→```typescript
  1263→const headers = {
  1264→  'X-API-Key': API_KEY,  // From environment
  1265→  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  1266→  'Accept': 'application/json',
  1267→};
  1268→```
  1269→
  1270→### Proxy vs Direct URL
  1271→```typescript
  1272→// For API calls (via proxy)
  1273→const API_BASE = '/api/rest';
  1274→
  1275→// For applookup values (direct)
  1276→const APPLOOKUP_BASE = 'https://my.living-apps.de/rest';
  1277→```
  1278→
  1279→---
  1280→
  1281→## 5. CRUD Operations
  1282→
  1283→### GET All Records
  1284→```typescript
  1285→GET /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records
  1286→```
  1287→
  1288→### GET Single Record
  1289→```typescript
  1290→GET /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1291→```
  1292→
  1293→### CREATE Record
  1294→```typescript
  1295→POST /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records
  1296→Content-Type: application/json
  1297→
  1298→{
  1299→  "name": "New Item",
  1300→  "value": 100
  1301→}
  1302→```
  1303→
  1304→### UPDATE Record
  1305→```typescript
  1306→PATCH /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1307→Content-Type: application/json
  1308→
  1309→{
  1310→  "value": 150  // Only changed fields
  1311→}
  1312→```
  1313→
  1314→### DELETE Record
  1315→```typescript
  1316→DELETE /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1317→
  1318→// Note: DELETE also returns JSON, always call response.json()
  1319→```
  1320→
  1321→---
  1322→
  1323→## 6. Error Handling
  1324→
  1325→```typescript
  1326→async function callAPI(method: string, endpoint: string, data?: any) {
  1327→  const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}${endpoint}`, {
  1328→    method,
  1329→    headers: {
  1330→      'X-API-Key': API_KEY,
  1331→      'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  1332→    },
  1333→    body: data ? JSON.stringify(data) : undefined,
  1334→  });
  1335→
  1336→  if (!response.ok) {
  1337→    const errorText = await response.text();
  1338→    throw new Error(`API Error (${response.status}): ${errorText}`);
  1339→  }
  1340→
  1341→  return response.json();  // Always parse JSON, even for DELETE
  1342→}
  1343→```
  1344→
  1345→---
  1346→
  1347→## 7. Metadata Structure
  1348→
  1349→`app_metadata.json` contains the **complete, real metadata from Living Apps REST API**.
  1350→
  1351→**IMPORTANT:**
  1352→- `controls` is an **OBJECT** (not array!)
  1353→- Each control has `identifier`, `label`, `type`, `subtype`, `fulltype`
  1354→- `lookup/select` has `lookup_data` with all options
  1355→- `applookup/select` has `lookup_app` URL to the linked app
  1356→
  1357→```typescript
  1358→{
  1359→  "appgroup_id": "...",
  1360→  "appgroup_name": "My App Group",
  1361→  "apps": {
  1362→    "app_identifier": {
  1363→      "app_id": "...",
  1364→      "name": "App Display Name",
  1365→      "controls": {
  1366→        "control_identifier": {
  1367→          "identifier": "field_name",      // Use this as field key
  1368→          "label": "Field Label",          // Use this for UI display
  1369→          "type": "string",                // Base type
  1370→          "subtype": null,                 // or "select", "textarea", etc.
  1371→          "fulltype": "string/text",       // Combined: type/subtype
  1372→          "lookup_data": [                 // For lookup/select fields
  1373→            { "key": "option1", "value": "Option 1" },
  1374→            { "key": "option2", "value": "Option 2" }
  1375→          ],
  1376→          "lookup_app": "https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}"  // For applookup
  1377→        }
  1378→      }
  1379→    }
  1380→  }
  1381→}
  1382→```
  1383→
  1384→### Common Field Types
  1385→| fulltype | TypeScript | Notes |
  1386→|----------|------------|-------|
  1387→| `string/text` | `string` | Plain text |
  1388→| `string/textarea` | `string` | Multiline text |
  1389→| `number/number` | `number` | Numeric |
  1390→| `bool/bool` | `boolean` | True/false |
  1391→| `date/date` | `string` | YYYY-MM-DD |
  1392→| `date/datetimeminute` | `string` | YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (NO seconds!) |
  1393→| `lookup/select` | `string` | From predefined list (lookup_data) |
  1394→| `applookup/select` | `string \| null` | URL to another app's record |
  1395→
  1396→### Using Metadata for UI
  1397→```typescript
  1398→// Use field labels for UI
  1399→const fieldLabel = metadata.apps.myapp.controls.myfield.label;
  1400→
  1401→// Use lookup_data for Select options
  1402→const options = metadata.apps.myapp.controls.status.lookup_data;
  1403→// → [{ key: "active", value: "Active" }, { key: "done", value: "Done" }]
  1404→```
  1405→
  1406→---
  1407→
  1408→# Code Patterns Reference
  1409→
  1410→## Available Libraries
  1411→
  1412→### shadcn/ui Components
  1413→
  1414→All shadcn components are pre-installed in `/src/components/ui/`
  1415→
  1416→```typescript
  1417→import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card';
  1418→import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
  1419→import { Badge } from '@/components/ui/badge';
  1420→import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input';
  1421→import { Select, SelectContent, SelectItem, SelectTrigger, SelectValue } from '@/components/ui/select';
  1422→import { Dialog, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogTrigger } from '@/components/ui/dialog';
  1423→import { Table, TableBody, TableCell, TableHead, TableHeader, TableRow } from '@/components/ui/table';
  1424→import { Skeleton } from '@/components/ui/skeleton';
  1425→import { Alert, AlertDescription, AlertTitle } from '@/components/ui/alert';
  1426→// etc.
  1427→```
  1428→
  1429→**To find specific components or examples, use shadcn MCP Tools:**
  1430→```
  1431→mcp_shadcn_search_items_in_registries(registries: ['@shadcn'], query: 'chart')
  1432→mcp_shadcn_view_items_in_registries(items: ['@shadcn/card'])
  1433→mcp_shadcn_get_item_examples_from_registries(registries: ['@shadcn'], query: 'card-demo')
  1434→```
  1435→
  1436→### react-router-dom (Routing)
  1437→
  1438→Pre-installed! Use for navigation between app pages:
  1439→```typescript
  1440→import { BrowserRouter, Routes, Route, NavLink, useNavigate, useParams } from 'react-router-dom';
  1441→```
  1442→
  1443→See: https://reactrouter.com/
  1444→
  1445→### recharts (Charts)
  1446→
  1447→Pre-installed! Use for visualizations:
  1448→```typescript
  1449→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
  1450→import { BarChart, Bar } from 'recharts';
  1451→import { PieChart, Pie, Cell } from 'recharts';
  1452→import { AreaChart, Area } from 'recharts';
  1453→```
  1454→
  1455→| Chart Type | Use Case |
  1456→|------------|----------|
  1457→| `LineChart` | Time series, trends |
  1458→| `BarChart` | Comparisons, categories |
  1459→| `PieChart` | Distributions, percentages |
  1460→| `AreaChart` | Cumulative trends |
  1461→
  1462→See: https://recharts.org/
  1463→
  1464→### lucide-react (Icons)
  1465→
  1466→Pre-installed! Use appropriate icons:
  1467→```typescript
  1468→import { 
  1469→  TrendingUp, TrendingDown,  // Trends
  1470→  AlertCircle, CheckCircle,   // Status
  1471→  PlusCircle, MinusCircle,    // Actions
  1472→  Calendar, Clock,            // Time
  1473→  User, Users,                // People
  1474→  DollarSign, Euro,           // Money
  1475→  Activity, Heart,            // Health/Fitness
  1476→  Package, ShoppingCart,      // Inventory
  1477→} from 'lucide-react';
  1478→```
  1479→
  1480→See: https://lucide.dev/
  1481→
  1482→### date-fns (Date Formatting)
  1483→
  1484→Pre-installed! Use for date formatting:
  1485→```typescript
  1486→import { format, parseISO, formatDistance } from 'date-fns';
  1487→import { de } from 'date-fns/locale';
  1488→
  1489→// Format for display
  1490→format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de });
  1491→// → "06.11.2025"
  1492→
  1493→format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'PPP', { locale: de });
  1494→// → "6. November 2025"
  1495→
  1496→// Relative time
  1497→formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { 
  1498→  addSuffix: true, 
  1499→  locale: de 
  1500→});
  1501→// → "vor 3 Tagen"
  1502→
  1503→// For input type="date"
  1504→const inputValue = record.datum?.split('T')[0] || '';
  1505→// → "2025-11-06"
  1506→```
  1507→
  1508→---
  1509→
  1510→## TypeScript Patterns
  1511→
  1512→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Type-Only Imports
  1513→
  1514→TypeScript's `verbatimModuleSyntax` requires explicit type imports:
  1515→
  1516→```typescript
  1517→// ❌ WRONG - TypeScript error
  1518→import { Workout, Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1519→
  1520→// ✅ CORRECT - Option 1 (preferred)
  1521→import type { Workout, Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1522→
  1523→// ✅ CORRECT - Option 2
  1524→import { type Workout, type Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1525→```
  1526→
  1527→---
  1528→
  1529→## Data Fetching Pattern
  1530→
  1531→```typescript
  1532→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
  1533→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
  1534→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1535→
  1536→function Dashboard() {
  1537→  const [data, setData] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
  1538→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  1539→  const [error, setError] = useState<Error | null>(null);
  1540→
  1541→  useEffect(() => {
  1542→    async function fetchData() {
  1543→      try {
  1544→        setLoading(true);
  1545→        const result = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
  1546→        setData(result);
  1547→      } catch (err) {
  1548→        setError(err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('Unknown error'));
  1549→      } finally {
  1550→        setLoading(false);
  1551→      }
  1552→    }
  1553→    fetchData();
  1554→  }, []);
  1555→
  1556→  if (loading) return <LoadingState />;
  1557→  if (error) return <ErrorState error={error} onRetry={() => window.location.reload()} />;
  1558→  if (data.length === 0) return <EmptyState />;
  1559→
  1560→  return <DashboardContent data={data} />;
  1561→}
  1562→```
  1563→
  1564→---
  1565→
  1566→## Relationship Handling (applookup)
  1567→
  1568→### Joining Data from Multiple Apps
  1569→
  1570→```typescript
  1571→import type { Workout, Exercise } from '@/types/app';
  1572→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1573→
  1574→function useDashboardData() {
  1575→  const [workouts, setWorkouts] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
  1576→  const [exercises, setExercises] = useState<Exercise[]>([]);
  1577→
  1578→  useEffect(() => {
  1579→    async function load() {
  1580→      const [w, e] = await Promise.all([
  1581→        LivingAppsService.getWorkouts(),
  1582→        LivingAppsService.getExercises(),
  1583→      ]);
  1584→      setWorkouts(w);
  1585→      setExercises(e);
  1586→    }
  1587→    load();
  1588→  }, []);
  1589→
  1590→  // Create lookup map for exercises
  1591→  const exerciseMap = useMemo(() => {
  1592→    const map = new Map<string, Exercise>();
  1593→    exercises.forEach(ex => map.set(ex.record_id, ex));
  1594→    return map;
  1595→  }, [exercises]);
  1596→
  1597→  // Enrich workouts with exercise data
  1598→  const enrichedWorkouts = useMemo(() => {
  1599→    return workouts.map(workout => {
  1600→      const exerciseId = extractRecordId(workout.fields.exercise);
  1601→      const exercise = exerciseId ? exerciseMap.get(exerciseId) : null;
  1602→      return { ...workout, exercise };
  1603→    });
  1604→  }, [workouts, exerciseMap]);
  1605→
  1606→  return { enrichedWorkouts, loading, error };
  1607→}
  1608→```
  1609→
  1610→### Grouping by Relationship
  1611→
  1612→```typescript
  1613→// Group items by a related record
  1614→function groupByRelation<T extends { fields: { [key: string]: any } }>(
  1615→  items: T[],
  1616→  relationField: string
  1617→): Map<string, T[]> {
  1618→  const groups = new Map<string, T[]>();
  1619→  
  1620→  items.forEach(item => {
  1621→    const relatedId = extractRecordId(item.fields[relationField]);
  1622→    if (!relatedId) return;  // ✅ Skip items without relation
  1623→    
  1624→    if (!groups.has(relatedId)) {
  1625→      groups.set(relatedId, []);
  1626→    }
  1627→    groups.get(relatedId)!.push(item);
  1628→  });
  1629→  
  1630→  return groups;
  1631→}
  1632→
  1633→// Usage
  1634→const workoutsByExercise = groupByRelation(workouts, 'exercise');
  1635→```
  1636→
  1637→---
  1638→
  1639→## Form Handling Pattern
  1640→
  1641→```typescript
  1642→import { useState } from 'react';
  1643→import type { WorkoutInput } from '@/types/app';
  1644→import { LivingAppsService, createRecordUrl, APP_IDS } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1645→
  1646→function AddWorkoutForm({ onSuccess }: { onSuccess: () => void }) {
  1647→  const [formData, setFormData] = useState<Partial<WorkoutInput>>({});
  1648→  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false);
  1649→
  1650→  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent) {
  1651→    e.preventDefault();
  1652→    setSubmitting(true);
  1653→
  1654→    try {
  1655→      // Transform data for API
  1656→      const apiData = {
  1657→        ...formData,
  1658→        // Date format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (no seconds!)
  1659→        datum: formData.datum + 'T12:00',
  1660→        // applookup: full URL
  1661→        exercise: formData.exerciseId 
  1662→          ? createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.EXERCISES, formData.exerciseId)
  1663→          : null,
  1664→      };
  1665→
  1666→      await LivingAppsService.createWorkout(apiData);
  1667→      onSuccess();
  1668→    } catch (err) {
  1669→      console.error('Failed to create:', err);
  1670→    } finally {
  1671→      setSubmitting(false);
  1672→    }
  1673→  }
  1674→
  1675→  return (
  1676→    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
  1677→      {/* Form fields */}
  1678→    </form>
  1679→  );
  1680→}
  1681→```
  1682→
  1683→---
  1684→
  1685→## shadcn/ui Component Patterns
  1686→
  1687→### Card with Stats
  1688→
  1689→```typescript
  1690→import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card';
  1691→
  1692→function StatCard({ title, value, icon: Icon }: StatProps) {
  1693→  return (
  1694→    <Card>
  1695→      <CardHeader className="flex flex-row items-center justify-between pb-2">
  1696→        <CardTitle className="text-sm font-medium text-muted-foreground">
  1697→          {title}
  1698→        </CardTitle>
  1699→        {Icon && <Icon className="h-4 w-4 text-muted-foreground" />}
  1700→      </CardHeader>
  1701→      <CardContent>
  1702→        <div className="text-2xl font-bold">{value}</div>
  1703→      </CardContent>
  1704→    </Card>
  1705→  );
  1706→}
  1707→```
  1708→
  1709→### ⚠️ Select Component - No Empty Strings!
  1710→
  1711→```typescript
  1712→// ❌ WRONG - Runtime error!
  1713→<SelectItem value="">No selection</SelectItem>
  1714→
  1715→// ✅ CORRECT - Use placeholder
  1716→<Select value={value} onValueChange={setValue}>
  1717→  <SelectTrigger>
  1718→    <SelectValue placeholder="Select option..." />
  1719→  </SelectTrigger>
  1720→  <SelectContent>
  1721→    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  1722→    <SelectItem value="option2">Option 2</SelectItem>
  1723→  </SelectContent>
  1724→</Select>
  1725→
  1726→// ✅ CORRECT - Use special value for "none"
  1727→<Select value={value || "none"} onValueChange={v => setValue(v === "none" ? "" : v)}>
  1728→  <SelectTrigger>
  1729→    <SelectValue />
  1730→  </SelectTrigger>
  1731→  <SelectContent>
  1732→    <SelectItem value="none">No selection</SelectItem>
  1733→    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  1734→  </SelectContent>
  1735→</Select>
  1736→```
  1737→
  1738→### Dialog for Actions
  1739→
  1740→```typescript
  1741→import {
  1742→  Dialog,
  1743→  DialogContent,
  1744→  DialogHeader,
  1745→  DialogTitle,
  1746→  DialogTrigger,
  1747→} from '@/components/ui/dialog';
  1748→
  1749→function ActionDialog({ trigger, title, children }: DialogProps) {
  1750→  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false);
  1751→
  1752→  return (
  1753→    <Dialog open={open} onOpenChange={setOpen}>
  1754→      <DialogTrigger asChild>
  1755→        {trigger}
  1756→      </DialogTrigger>
  1757→      <DialogContent className="sm:max-w-md">
  1758→        <DialogHeader>
  1759→          <DialogTitle>{title}</DialogTitle>
  1760→        </DialogHeader>
  1761→        {children}
  1762→      </DialogContent>
  1763→    </Dialog>
  1764→  );
  1765→}
  1766→```
  1767→
  1768→---
  1769→
  1770→## Chart Patterns (recharts)
  1771→
  1772→### Basic Line Chart
  1773→
  1774→```typescript
  1775→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
  1776→
  1777→function TrendChart({ data }: { data: Array<{ name: string; value: number }> }) {
  1778→  return (
  1779→    <div className="h-[300px]">
  1780→      <ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height="100%">
  1781→        <LineChart data={data}>
  1782→          <XAxis 
  1783→            dataKey="name" 
  1784→            tick={{ fontSize: 12 }}
  1785→            stroke="hsl(var(--muted-foreground))"
  1786→          />
  1787→          <YAxis 
  1788→            tick={{ fontSize: 12 }}
  1789→            stroke="hsl(var(--muted-foreground))"
  1790→          />
  1791→          <Tooltip 
  1792→            contentStyle={{ 
  1793→              backgroundColor: 'hsl(var(--background))',
  1794→              border: '1px solid hsl(var(--border))',
  1795→            }}
  1796→          />
  1797→          <Line 
  1798→            type="monotone" 
  1799→            dataKey="value" 
  1800→            stroke="hsl(var(--primary))"
  1801→            strokeWidth={2}
  1802→            dot={false}
  1803→          />
  1804→        </LineChart>
  1805→      </ResponsiveContainer>
  1806→    </div>
  1807→  );
  1808→}
  1809→```
  1810→
  1811→### Data Aggregation for Charts
  1812→
  1813→```typescript
  1814→// Group by date
  1815→function aggregateByDate<T extends { createdat: string }>(
  1816→  items: T[],
  1817→  valueExtractor: (item: T) => number
  1818→): Array<{ date: string; value: number }> {
  1819→  const groups = new Map<string, number>();
  1820→  
  1821→  items.forEach(item => {
  1822→    const date = item.createdat.split('T')[0];  // YYYY-MM-DD
  1823→    const current = groups.get(date) || 0;
  1824→    groups.set(date, current + valueExtractor(item));
  1825→  });
  1826→  
  1827→  return Array.from(groups.entries())
  1828→    .map(([date, value]) => ({ date, value }))
  1829→    .sort((a, b) => a.date.localeCompare(b.date));
  1830→}
  1831→```
  1832→
  1833→---
  1834→
  1835→## Date Formatting (date-fns)
  1836→
  1837→```typescript
  1838→import { format, parseISO, formatDistance } from 'date-fns';
  1839→import { de } from 'date-fns/locale';
  1840→
  1841→// Format for display
  1842→const formatted = format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de });
  1843→// → "06.11.2025"
  1844→
  1845→// Relative time
  1846→const relative = formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { 
  1847→  addSuffix: true,
  1848→  locale: de 
  1849→});
  1850→// → "vor 3 Tagen"
  1851→
  1852→// For input type="date"
  1853→const inputValue = record.datum?.split('T')[0] || '';
  1854→// → "2025-11-06"
  1855→```
  1856→
  1857→---
  1858→
  1859→## Utility Functions
  1860→
  1861→### Safe Number Formatting
  1862→
  1863→```typescript
  1864→function formatNumber(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1865→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1866→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE').format(value);
  1867→}
  1868→
  1869→function formatCurrency(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1870→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1871→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', {
  1872→    style: 'currency',
  1873→    currency: 'EUR',
  1874→  }).format(value);
  1875→}
  1876→
  1877→function formatPercent(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1878→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1879→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', {
  1880→    style: 'percent',
  1881→    minimumFractionDigits: 1,
  1882→  }).format(value / 100);
  1883→}
  1884→```
  1885→
  1886→### Calculate KPIs
  1887→
  1888→```typescript
  1889→function calculateStats<T>(
  1890→  items: T[],
  1891→  valueExtractor: (item: T) => number | null | undefined
  1892→) {
  1893→  const values = items
  1894→    .map(valueExtractor)
  1895→    .filter((v): v is number => v != null);
  1896→  
  1897→  if (values.length === 0) {
  1898→    return { sum: 0, avg: 0, min: 0, max: 0, count: 0 };
  1899→  }
  1900→  
  1901→  return {
  1902→    sum: values.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0),
  1903→    avg: values.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / values.length,
  1904→    min: Math.min(...values),
  1905→    max: Math.max(...values),
  1906→    count: values.length,
  1907→  };
  1908→}
  1909→```
  1910→

# Design Brief: Kursverwaltung

## 1. App Analysis

### What This App Does
Kursverwaltung (Course Management) is a comprehensive system for managing educational courses, instructors, rooms, participants, and registrations. It handles the full lifecycle from course creation through participant enrollment and payment tracking.

### Who Uses This
A course administrator or educational coordinator who manages multiple courses, needs to see enrollment status at a glance, track payments, and manage the relationships between courses, instructors, rooms, and participants.

### The ONE Thing Users Care About Most
**How are my courses doing?** Specifically: How many registrations do I have, are they paid, and which courses need attention? The total registration count and payment status is the immediate pulse of the business.

### Primary Actions (IMPORTANT!)
1. **Neue Anmeldung** (New Registration) - Primary Action Button. This is the most frequent action - enrolling a participant in a course.
2. Add a new course
3. Add a new participant
4. Mark a registration as paid

---

## 2. What Makes This Design Distinctive

### Visual Identity
The design uses a refined academic aesthetic with a warm ivory background and a deep teal accent that evokes trust and professionalism. The typography uses Plus Jakarta Sans - a geometric sans-serif with slightly rounded terminals that feels approachable yet authoritative. The overall feel is "well-organized university administration" rather than corporate sterility.

### Layout Strategy
The dashboard overview uses an asymmetric layout with a prominent hero section spanning the full width showing the key registration/revenue metrics. Below, the layout splits into a 2/3 main area (registration trend chart + upcoming courses) and 1/3 supporting column (payment status + quick stats). This creates a natural reading flow from top-level KPIs down to actionable details.

On mobile, everything stacks vertically with the hero KPI dominating the first viewport. The chart simplifies to show fewer data points, and tables become card lists.

### Unique Element
The hero section uses a large registration count with a subtle circular progress indicator showing the payment completion rate (bezahlt vs. unbezahlt). The progress ring uses the teal accent color with a 6px stroke, creating a visual "health meter" for the course business that is immediately scannable.

---

## 3. Theme & Colors

### Font
- **Family:** Plus Jakarta Sans
- **URL:** `https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Plus+Jakarta+Sans:wght@300;400;500;600;700;800&display=swap`
- **Why this font:** Plus Jakarta Sans has geometric proportions with soft, rounded details that make data-heavy interfaces feel approachable. The wide weight range (300-800) enables strong visual hierarchy.

### Color Palette
All colors as complete hsl() functions:

| Purpose | Color | CSS Variable |
|---------|-------|--------------|
| Page background | `hsl(40 30% 97%)` | `--background` |
| Main text | `hsl(220 20% 14%)` | `--foreground` |
| Card background | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--card` |
| Card text | `hsl(220 20% 14%)` | `--card-foreground` |
| Borders | `hsl(40 15% 90%)` | `--border` |
| Primary action (teal) | `hsl(174 62% 32%)` | `--primary` |
| Text on primary | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--primary-foreground` |
| Accent highlight | `hsl(174 40% 94%)` | `--accent` |
| Accent foreground | `hsl(174 62% 22%)` | `--accent-foreground` |
| Muted background | `hsl(40 20% 95%)` | `--muted` |
| Muted text | `hsl(220 10% 46%)` | `--muted-foreground` |
| Success/positive | `hsl(152 55% 40%)` | (component use) |
| Error/negative | `hsl(0 72% 51%)` | `--destructive` |
| Secondary | `hsl(40 20% 95%)` | `--secondary` |
| Secondary foreground | `hsl(220 20% 14%)` | `--secondary-foreground` |

### Why These Colors
The warm ivory background (hsl 40 30% 97%) avoids the clinical feel of pure white, giving a subtle warmth reminiscent of paper. The deep teal primary (hsl 174 62% 32%) is a refined, non-generic accent that conveys trust and knowledge - fitting for an educational context. The muted foreground (hsl 220 10% 46%) provides comfortable reading contrast without the harshness of pure black.

### Background Treatment
Subtle warm ivory base (not pure white). Cards sit on pure white, creating gentle depth through contrast alone without needing heavy shadows.

---

## 4. Mobile Layout (Phone)

### Layout Approach
Single column vertical flow. The hero KPI dominates the first viewport with large typography (48px bold for the number). Secondary KPIs use a compact 2-column grid. Below the fold: a simplified chart, then course list as swipeable cards. The bottom navigation provides access to all app pages.

### What Users See (Top to Bottom)

**Header:**
App title "Kursverwaltung" left-aligned in 700 weight, 20px. A "+" button for quick registration on the right.

**Hero Section (The FIRST thing users see):**
Full-width card with teal-tinted background (accent color at 10% opacity). Shows:
- "Anmeldungen gesamt" label in 13px muted text
- The total registration count in 48px, 800 weight
- Below: a horizontal bar split into teal (bezahlt/paid) and muted gray (unbezahlt/unpaid) segments, showing payment completion visually
- Below the bar: "X von Y bezahlt" in 14px muted text

Why hero: Registration count is the #1 indicator of business health.

**Section 2: Quick Stats (2-column grid)**
Four compact stat cards in a 2x2 grid:
- Aktive Kurse (active courses count)
- Dozenten (instructor count)
- Teilnehmer (participant count)
- Umsatz (total revenue from paid registrations)

Each card: title in 12px muted, value in 24px 700 weight. No icons needed - the numbers speak.

**Section 3: Anmeldungen Trend (Chart)**
Bar chart showing registrations per month (last 6 months). Simplified: no Y-axis labels on mobile, just bars with hover tooltips. Teal colored bars. Title "Anmeldungen pro Monat" in 16px 600 weight.

**Section 4: Kommende Kurse (Upcoming Courses)**
List of courses sorted by startdatum (soonest first), filtered to future dates. Each item shows:
- Kurstitel in 15px 600 weight
- Date range "DD.MM.YYYY - DD.MM.YYYY" in 13px muted
- Registration count / max participants as badge on right
- Dozent name below title in 13px muted

Max 5 items shown, with "Alle Kurse anzeigen" link to /kurse page.

**Bottom Navigation:**
Fixed bottom tab bar with 5 items. Padding bottom on main content: pb-20.

### Mobile-Specific Adaptations
- Chart shows only 4-6 months of data
- Tables become card lists with stacked fields
- Dialogs take full screen on small devices (sm:max-w-md on desktop)
- Touch targets minimum 44px height

### Touch Targets
All buttons and interactive elements minimum 44px touch target. Card items in lists have full-width tap area.

---

## 5. Desktop Layout

### Overall Structure
Fixed left sidebar (256px wide) for navigation. Main content area uses max-width 1200px with generous padding (32px).

**Top area:** Page title + primary action button in a flex row.

**Hero row:** Full-width card spanning entire content area with the registration KPI + payment progress bar. Same content as mobile but laid out horizontally: the large number on the left, the progress bar in the center, and the revenue figure on the right.

**Second row (2/3 + 1/3 split):**
- Left (2/3): Bar chart "Anmeldungen pro Monat" showing last 12 months
- Right (1/3): Stack of 4 stat cards (Aktive Kurse, Dozenten, Teilnehmer, Freie Plätze)

**Third row (full width):**
Upcoming courses table with columns: Kurstitel, Dozent, Raum, Startdatum, Enddatum, Anmeldungen/Max, Preis. With edit/view actions on hover.

### Section Layout
- Sidebar: 256px fixed left, always visible
- Content: margin-left 256px, max-width 1200px, padding 32px
- Hero: full content width, 120px height
- Chart + Stats: grid grid-cols-3, chart spans 2 cols, stats 1 col
- Courses table: full content width

### What Appears on Hover
- Table rows: subtle background highlight + edit/delete action buttons appear on far right
- Stat cards: slight shadow elevation
- Chart bars: tooltip with exact count and month name

### Clickable/Interactive Areas
- Course rows in table: click to navigate to /kurse page (or open detail)
- Stat cards: click navigates to corresponding app page (Kurse, Dozenten, Teilnehmer)
- "Alle anzeigen" links on each section navigate to full app page

---

## 6. Components

### Hero KPI
- **Title:** Anmeldungen gesamt
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen app - count all records
- **Calculation:** Total count of all Anmeldungen records
- **Display:** Large 48px/800-weight number on mobile, 56px on desktop. Teal-tinted card background.
- **Context shown:** Payment completion bar below (count of bezahlt=true vs total). Revenue sum on desktop.
- **Why this is the hero:** The registration count is the immediate pulse of the course business - it tells the admin if things are going well.

### Secondary KPIs

**Aktive Kurse**
- Source: Kurse app
- Calculation: Count of courses where enddatum >= today (or enddatum is null)
- Format: number
- Display: Compact card, 24px bold value

**Dozenten**
- Source: Dozenten app
- Calculation: Total count
- Format: number
- Display: Compact card, 24px bold value

**Teilnehmer**
- Source: Teilnehmer app
- Calculation: Total count
- Format: number
- Display: Compact card, 24px bold value

**Gesamtumsatz**
- Source: Anmeldungen (bezahlt=true) joined with Kurse (preis)
- Calculation: Sum of preis for all paid registrations (lookup kurs -> kurse.preis, sum where bezahlt=true)
- Format: currency EUR
- Display: Compact card, 24px bold value

### Chart
- **Type:** Bar chart - bar charts are best for comparing discrete time periods (months), making it easy to spot registration trends
- **Title:** Anmeldungen pro Monat
- **What question it answers:** Is registration volume growing, stable, or declining over time?
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen app, grouped by anmeldedatum month
- **X-axis:** Month (format: "MMM yyyy" e.g. "Jan 2025")
- **Y-axis:** Count of registrations
- **Colors:** Teal (primary) for bars
- **Mobile simplification:** Show only last 6 months, hide Y-axis labels, smaller bar width

### Lists/Tables

**Kommende Kurse (Upcoming Courses)**
- Purpose: Shows which courses are coming up and their enrollment status
- Source: Kurse app (filtered to future startdatum) + Anmeldungen (count per course) + Dozenten (name lookup) + Raeume (name lookup)
- Fields shown (mobile): Kurstitel, date range, enrollment count/max, dozent name
- Fields shown (desktop table): Kurstitel, Dozent (full name), Raum, Startdatum, Enddatum, Anmeldungen/Max, Preis
- Mobile style: card list
- Desktop style: table with hover actions
- Sort: By startdatum ascending (soonest first)
- Limit: 5 on dashboard overview, full list on /kurse page

### Primary Action Button (REQUIRED!)
- **Label:** Neue Anmeldung
- **Action:** add_record
- **Target app:** Anmeldungen
- **What data:** kurs (select from Kurse), teilnehmer (select from Teilnehmer), anmeldedatum (date, default today), bezahlt (checkbox, default false)
- **Mobile position:** header (top right "+" icon button)
- **Desktop position:** header (top right full button "Neue Anmeldung")
- **Why this action:** Registration is the most frequent daily task - every new participant needs to be enrolled.

### CRUD Operations Per App (REQUIRED!)

**Kurse CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Kurs erstellen" button on /kurse page header. Dialog with fields: titel (text, required), beschreibung (textarea), startdatum (date), enddatum (date), maximale_teilnehmer (number), preis (number), dozent (select from Dozenten app - show "Vorname Nachname"), raum (select from Raeume app - show "Raumname (Gebaeude)")
- **Read:** Table on /kurse page. Columns: Titel, Dozent, Raum, Start, Ende, Teilnehmer/Max, Preis. Mobile: card list with titel, dates, enrollment badge.
- **Update:** Pencil icon on each row -> same dialog as Create, pre-filled with current values
- **Delete:** Trash icon on each row -> Confirmation: "Kurs '{titel}' wirklich loschen?"

**Raeume CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Raum erstellen" button on /raeume page header. Dialog with fields: raumname (text, required), gebaeude (text), kapazitaet (number)
- **Read:** Table on /raeume page. Columns: Raumname, Gebaude, Kapazitat. Mobile: simple card list.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Raum '{raumname}' wirklich loschen?"

**Dozenten CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Dozenten erstellen" button on /dozenten page. Dialog with fields: vorname (text, required), nachname (text, required), email (email), telefon (tel), fachgebiet (text)
- **Read:** Table on /dozenten page. Columns: Name (vorname + nachname), E-Mail, Telefon, Fachgebiet. Mobile: card list with name and fachgebiet.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Dozent '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich loschen?"

**Anmeldungen CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neue Anmeldung" button (also primary action from dashboard). Dialog with: kurs (select from Kurse - show titel), teilnehmer (select from Teilnehmer - show "vorname nachname"), anmeldedatum (date, default today), bezahlt (checkbox, default false)
- **Read:** Table on /anmeldungen page. Columns: Teilnehmer (name), Kurs (titel), Anmeldedatum, Bezahlt (badge). Mobile: card list.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled. Especially useful for toggling bezahlt status.
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Anmeldung von '{teilnehmer name}' fur '{kurs titel}' wirklich loschen?"

**Teilnehmer CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Teilnehmer erstellen" button on /teilnehmer page. Dialog with: vorname (text, required), nachname (text, required), email (email), telefon (tel), geburtsdatum (date)
- **Read:** Table on /teilnehmer page. Columns: Name (vorname + nachname), E-Mail, Telefon, Geburtsdatum. Mobile: card list with name and email.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Teilnehmer '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich loschen?"

---

## 7. Navigation (React Router)

### Navigation Structure
- **Navigation style:** Sidebar (desktop) + Bottom tabs (mobile)
- **Dashboard/Home route:** Overview with KPIs, registration chart, upcoming courses summary

### Routes

| Route | Page | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `/` | Dashboard Overview | Summary KPIs, hero registration count, chart, upcoming courses |
| `/kurse` | Kurse | Full CRUD table for courses |
| `/anmeldungen` | Anmeldungen | Full CRUD table for registrations |
| `/teilnehmer` | Teilnehmer | Full CRUD table for participants |
| `/dozenten` | Dozenten | Full CRUD table for instructors |
| `/raeume` | Raeume | Full CRUD table for rooms |

### Navigation Design

**Desktop:**
Fixed sidebar on the left (256px width). Background: white (card color). Border-right. Top: app title "Kursverwaltung" in 18px 700 weight with a small graduation cap icon (GraduationCap from lucide). Below: nav items with icon + label. Each item 44px height, 12px horizontal padding. Active item: teal background (primary at 10% opacity) with teal text (primary color). Inactive: muted-foreground text, hover shows muted background.

**Mobile:**
Fixed bottom tab bar, 5 tabs. Icons only on tabs (labels below in 10px). Tabs: Home (LayoutDashboard), Kurse (BookOpen), Anmeldungen (ClipboardList), Teilnehmer (Users), Mehr (Menu) - "Mehr" opens a sheet/drawer with Dozenten and Raeume links.

Icons for navigation:
- Dashboard: LayoutDashboard
- Kurse: BookOpen
- Anmeldungen: ClipboardList
- Teilnehmer: Users
- Dozenten: GraduationCap
- Raeume: DoorOpen

### Active Route Indicator
Desktop sidebar: Active nav item has `bg-primary/10 text-primary font-semibold` styling with a 3px left border in primary color. Inactive items are `text-muted-foreground hover:bg-muted`.

Mobile bottom tabs: Active tab icon and label are primary color. Inactive are muted-foreground.

### Dashboard Overview Page (/)
Shows:
- Hero KPI (total registrations + payment progress)
- 4 secondary stat cards (active courses, instructors, participants, revenue)
- Registration trend bar chart
- Upcoming courses list (5 items) with link to /kurse
- Quick action: "Neue Anmeldung" button in header

---

## 8. Visual Details

### Border Radius
Rounded (8px) - the `--radius: 0.625rem` is already set. Cards use `rounded-xl` (12px) for a slightly softer feel. Buttons use `rounded-lg` (8px). Badges use `rounded-full`.

### Shadows
Subtle - Cards use `shadow-sm` (a very light shadow) to create gentle depth on the warm ivory background. Hover on interactive cards elevates to `shadow-md`. No heavy drop shadows anywhere.

### Spacing
Normal to spacious - 16px gap between cards, 24px between sections, 32px page padding on desktop, 16px on mobile. Content breathes.

### Animations
- **Page load:** Fade in with slight upward motion (200ms ease-out)
- **Page transitions:** Simple fade (150ms)
- **Hover effects:** Cards: shadow elevation transition 200ms. Table rows: background color transition 150ms.
- **Tap feedback:** Active state scales to 0.98 on buttons (transform transition 100ms)

---

## 9. CSS Variables (Copy Exactly!)

```css
:root {
  --radius: 0.625rem;
  --background: hsl(40 30% 97%);
  --foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --card: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --card-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --popover: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --popover-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --primary: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --primary-foreground: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --secondary: hsl(40 20% 95%);
  --secondary-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --muted: hsl(40 20% 95%);
  --muted-foreground: hsl(220 10% 46%);
  --accent: hsl(174 40% 94%);
  --accent-foreground: hsl(174 62% 22%);
  --destructive: hsl(0 72% 51%);
  --border: hsl(40 15% 90%);
  --input: hsl(40 15% 90%);
  --ring: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --chart-1: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --chart-2: hsl(152 55% 40%);
  --chart-3: hsl(40 80% 56%);
  --chart-4: hsl(220 60% 55%);
  --chart-5: hsl(280 55% 55%);
  --sidebar: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --sidebar-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --sidebar-primary: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --sidebar-primary-foreground: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --sidebar-accent: hsl(174 40% 94%);
  --sidebar-accent-foreground: hsl(174 62% 22%);
  --sidebar-border: hsl(40 15% 90%);
  --sidebar-ring: hsl(174 62% 32%);
}
```

---

## 10. Implementation Checklist

The implementer should verify:
- [ ] Font loaded from URL above (Plus Jakarta Sans, weights 300-800)
- [ ] All CSS variables copied exactly from Section 9
- [ ] Mobile layout matches Section 4
- [ ] Desktop layout matches Section 5
- [ ] Hero element is prominent as described
- [ ] Colors create warm, academic mood described in Section 2
- [ ] React Router navigation implemented with all routes from Section 7
- [ ] Each app has its own page/route with full CRUD
- [ ] Navigation works on both mobile (bottom tabs) and desktop (sidebar)
- [ ] CRUD patterns are consistent across all apps
- [ ] Delete confirmations are in place
- [ ] Toast notifications for all CRUD operations
- [ ] Loading skeletons for data fetching
- [ ] Empty states with guidance
- [ ] Error states with retry

toolUseResult.content:
# Design Brief: Kursverwaltung

## 1. App Analysis

### What This App Does
Kursverwaltung (Course Management) is a comprehensive system for managing educational courses, instructors, rooms, participants, and registrations. It handles the full lifecycle from course creation through participant enrollment and payment tracking.

### Who Uses This
A course administrator or educational coordinator who manages multiple courses, needs to see enrollment status at a glance, track payments, and manage the relationships between courses, instructors, rooms, and participants.

### The ONE Thing Users Care About Most
**How are my courses doing?** Specifically: How many registrations do I have, are they paid, and which courses need attention? The total registration count and payment status is the immediate pulse of the business.

### Primary Actions (IMPORTANT!)
1. **Neue Anmeldung** (New Registration) - Primary Action Button. This is the most frequent action - enrolling a participant in a course.
2. Add a new course
3. Add a new participant
4. Mark a registration as paid

---

## 2. What Makes This Design Distinctive

### Visual Identity
The design uses a refined academic aesthetic with a warm ivory background and a deep teal accent that evokes trust and professionalism. The typography uses Plus Jakarta Sans - a geometric sans-serif with slightly rounded terminals that feels approachable yet authoritative. The overall feel is "well-organized university administration" rather than corporate sterility.

### Layout Strategy
The dashboard overview uses an asymmetric layout with a prominent hero section spanning the full width showing the key registration/revenue metrics. Below, the layout splits into a 2/3 main area (registration trend chart + upcoming courses) and 1/3 supporting column (payment status + quick stats). This creates a natural reading flow from top-level KPIs down to actionable details.

On mobile, everything stacks vertically with the hero KPI dominating the first viewport. The chart simplifies to show fewer data points, and tables become card lists.

### Unique Element
The hero section uses a large registration count with a subtle circular progress indicator showing the payment completion rate (bezahlt vs. unbezahlt). The progress ring uses the teal accent color with a 6px stroke, creating a visual "health meter" for the course business that is immediately scannable.

---

| Borders | `hsl(40 15% 90%)` | `--border` |
| Primary action (teal) | `hsl(174 62% 32%)` | `--primary` |
| Text on primary | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--primary-foreground` |
| Accent highlight | `hsl(174 40% 94%)` | `--accent` |
| Accent foreground | `hsl(174 62% 22%)` | `--accent-foreground` |
| Muted background | `hsl(40 20% 95%)` | `--muted` |
| Muted text | `hsl(220 10% 46%)` | `--muted-foreground` |
| Success/positive | `hsl(152 55% 40%)` | (component use) |
| Error/negative | `hsl(0 72% 51%)` | `--destructive` |
| Secondary | `hsl(40 20% 95%)` | `--secondary` |
| Secondary foreground | `hsl(220 20% 14%)` | `--secondary-foreground` |

### Why These Colors
The warm ivory background (hsl 40 30% 97%) avoids the clinical feel of pure white, giving a subtle warmth reminiscent of paper.
