- Display: Compact card, 24px bold value

### Chart
- **Type:** Bar chart - bar charts are best for comparing discrete time periods (months), making it easy to spot registration trends
- **Title:** Anmeldungen pro Monat
- **What question it answers:** Is registration volume growing, stable, or declining over time?
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen app, grouped by anmeldedatum month
- **X-axis:** Month (format: "MMM yyyy" e.g. "Jan 2025")
- **Y-axis:** Count of registrations
- **Colors:** Teal (primary) for bars
- **Mobile simplification:** Show only last 6 months, hide Y-axis labels, smaller bar width

### Lists/Tables

**Kommende Kurse (Upcoming Courses)**
- Purpose: Shows which courses are coming up and their enrollment status
- Source: Kurse app (filtered to future startdatum) + Anmeldungen (count per course) + Dozenten (name lookup) + Raeume (name lookup)
- Fields shown (mobile): Kurstitel, date range, enrollment count/max, dozent name
- Fields shown (desktop table): Kurstitel, Dozent (full name), Raum, Startdatum, Enddatum, Anmeldungen/Max, Preis
- Mobile style: card list
- Desktop style: table with hover actions
- Sort: By startdatum ascending (soonest first)
- Limit: 5 on dashboard overview, full list on /kurse page

### Primary Action Button (REQUIRED!)
- **Label:** Neue Anmeldung
- **Action:** add_record
- **Target app:** Anmeldungen
- **What data:** kurs (select from Kurse), teilnehmer (select from Teilnehmer), anmeldedatum (date, default today), bezahlt (checkbox, default false)
- **Mobile position:** header (top right "+" icon button)
- **Desktop position:** header (top right full button "Neue Anmeldung")
- **Why this action:** Registration is the most frequent daily task - every new participant needs to be enrolled.

### CRUD Operations Per App (REQUIRED!)

**Kurse CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Kurs erstellen" button on /kurse page header. Dialog with fields: titel (text, required), beschreibung (textarea), startdatum (date), enddatum (date), maximale_teilnehmer (number), preis (number), dozent (select from Dozenten app - show "Vorname Nachname"), raum (select from Raeume app - show "Raumname (Gebaeude)")
- **Read:** Table on /kurse page. Columns: Titel, Dozent, Raum, Start, Ende, Teilnehmer/Max, Preis. Mobile: card list with titel, dates, enrollment badge.
- **Update:** Pencil icon on each row -> same dialog as Create, pre-filled with current values
- **Delete:** Trash icon on each row -> Confirmation: "Kurs '{titel}' wirklich loschen?"

**Raeume CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Raum erstellen" button on /raeume page header. Dialog with fields: raumname (text, required), gebaeude (text), kapazitaet (number)
- **Read:** Table on /raeume page. Columns: Raumname, Gebaude, Kapazitat. Mobile: simple card list.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Raum '{raumname}' wirklich loschen?"

**Dozenten CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Dozenten erstellen" button on /dozenten page. Dialog with fields: vorname (text, required), nachname (text, required), email (email), telefon (tel), fachgebiet (text)
- **Read:** Table on /dozenten page. Columns: Name (vorname + nachname), E-Mail, Telefon, Fachgebiet. Mobile: card list with name and fachgebiet.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Dozent '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich loschen?"

**Anmeldungen CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neue Anmeldung" button (also primary action from dashboard). Dialog with: kurs (select from Kurse - show titel), teilnehmer (select from Teilnehmer - show "vorname nachname"), anmeldedatum (date, default today), bezahlt (checkbox, default false)
- **Read:** Table on /anmeldungen page. Columns: Teilnehmer (name), Kurs (titel), Anmeldedatum, Bezahlt (badge). Mobile: card list.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled. Especially useful for toggling bezahlt status.
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Anmeldung von '{teilnehmer name}' fur '{kurs titel}' wirklich loschen?"

**Teilnehmer CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "Neuen Teilnehmer erstellen" button on /teilnehmer page. Dialog with: vorname (text, required), nachname (text, required), email (email), telefon (tel), geburtsdatum (date)
- **Read:** Table on /teilnehmer page. Columns: Name (vorname + nachname), E-Mail, Telefon, Geburtsdatum. Mobile: card list with name and email.
- **Update:** Pencil icon -> same dialog pre-filled
- **Delete:** Trash icon -> Confirmation: "Teilnehmer '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich loschen?"

---

## 7. Navigation (React Router)

### Navigation Structure
- **Navigation style:** Sidebar (desktop) + Bottom tabs (mobile)
- **Dashboard/Home route:** Overview with KPIs, registration chart, upcoming courses summary

### Routes

| Route | Page | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `/` | Dashboard Overview | Summary KPIs, hero registration count, chart, upcoming courses |
| `/kurse` | Kurse | Full CRUD table for courses |
| `/anmeldungen` | Anmeldungen | Full CRUD table for registrations |
| `/teilnehmer` | Teilnehmer | Full CRUD table for participants |
| `/dozenten` | Dozenten | Full CRUD table for instructors |
| `/raeume` | Raeume | Full CRUD table for rooms |

### Navigation Design

**Desktop:**
Fixed sidebar on the left (256px width). Background: white (card color). Border-right. Top: app title "Kursverwaltung" in 18px 700 weight with a small graduation cap icon (GraduationCap from lucide). Below: nav items with icon + label. Each item 44px height, 12px horizontal padding. Active item: teal background (primary at 10% opacity) with teal text (primary color). Inactive: muted-foreground text, hover shows muted background.

**Mobile:**
Fixed bottom tab bar, 5 tabs. Icons only on tabs (labels below in 10px). Tabs: Home (LayoutDashboard), Kurse (BookOpen), Anmeldungen (ClipboardList), Teilnehmer (Users), Mehr (Menu) - "Mehr" opens a sheet/drawer with Dozenten and Raeume links.

Icons for navigation:
- Dashboard: LayoutDashboard
- Kurse: BookOpen
- Anmeldungen: ClipboardList
- Teilnehmer: Users
- Dozenten: GraduationCap
- Raeume: DoorOpen

### Active Route Indicator
Desktop sidebar: Active nav item has `bg-primary/10 text-primary font-semibold` styling with a 3px left border in primary color. Inactive items are `text-muted-foreground hover:bg-muted`.

Mobile bottom tabs: Active tab icon and label are primary color. Inactive are muted-foreground.

### Dashboard Overview Page (/)
Shows:
- Hero KPI (total registrations + payment progress)
- 4 secondary stat cards (active courses, instructors, participants, revenue)
- Registration trend bar chart
- Upcoming courses list (5 items) with link to /kurse
- Quick action: "Neue Anmeldung" button in header

---

## 8. Visual Details

### Border Radius
Rounded (8px) - the `--radius: 0.625rem` is already set. Cards use `rounded-xl` (12px) for a slightly softer feel. Buttons use `rounded-lg` (8px). Badges use `rounded-full`.

### Shadows
Subtle - Cards use `shadow-sm` (a very light shadow) to create gentle depth on the warm ivory background. Hover on interactive cards elevates to `shadow-md`. No heavy drop shadows anywhere.

### Spacing
Normal to spacious - 16px gap between cards, 24px between sections, 32px page padding on desktop, 16px on mobile. Content breathes.

### Animations
- **Page load:** Fade in with slight upward motion (200ms ease-out)
- **Page transitions:** Simple fade (150ms)
- **Hover effects:** Cards: shadow elevation transition 200ms. Table rows: background color transition 150ms.
- **Tap feedback:** Active state scales to 0.98 on buttons (transform transition 100ms)

---

## 9. CSS Variables (Copy Exactly!)

```css
  --radius: 0.625rem;
  --background: hsl(40 30% 97%);

  --popover: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --popover-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --primary: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --primary-foreground: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --secondary: hsl(40 20% 95%);
  --secondary-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --muted: hsl(40 20% 95%);
  --muted-foreground: hsl(220 10% 46%);
  --accent: hsl(174 40% 94%);
  --accent-foreground: hsl(174 62% 22%);
  --destructive: hsl(0 72% 51%);
  --border: hsl(40 15% 90%);
  --input: hsl(40 15% 90%);
  --ring: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --chart-1: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --chart-2: hsl(152 55% 40%);
  --chart-3: hsl(40 80% 56%);
  --chart-4: hsl(220 60% 55%);
  --chart-5: hsl(280 55% 55%);
  --sidebar: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --sidebar-foreground: hsl(220 20% 14%);
  --sidebar-primary: hsl(174 62% 32%);
  --sidebar-primary-foreground: hsl(0 0% 100%);
  --sidebar-accent: hsl(174 40% 94%);
  --sidebar-accent-foreground: hsl(174 62% 22%);
  --sidebar-border: hsl(40 15% 90%);
  --sidebar-ring: hsl(174 62% 32%);
}
```

---

## 10. Implementation Checklist

The implementer should verify:
- [ ] Font loaded from URL above (Plus Jakarta Sans, weights 300-800)
- [ ] All CSS variables copied exactly from Section 9
- [ ] Mobile layout matches Section 4
- [ ] Desktop layout matches Section 5
- [ ] Hero element is prominent as described
- [ ] Colors create warm, academic mood described in Section 2
- [ ] React Router navigation implemented with all routes from Section 7
- [ ] Each app has its own page/route with full CRUD
- [ ] Navigation works on both mobile (bottom tabs) and desktop (sidebar)
- [ ] CRUD patterns are consistent across all apps
- [ ] Delete confirmations are in place
- [ ] Toast notifications for all CRUD operations
- [ ] Loading skeletons for data fetching
- [ ] Empty states with guidance
- [ ] Error states with retry

**Exported component:** `TeilnehmerPage` (named export, matching the pattern of `KursePage` and `AnmeldungenPage`)

**Structure follows the exact same patterns as the existing pages:**

1. **State management** -- `useState` for `teilnehmer` array, `loading`, `error`, `showCreate`, `editRecord`, `deleteRecord`, and `deleting` states, matching the pattern in both existing pages.

2. **Data fetching** -- `refreshData()` async function called in `useEffect` on mount, using `LivingAppsService.getTeilnehmer()`. Simpler than KursePage/AnmeldungenPage since no related data needs loading via `Promise.all`.

3. **Helper function** -- `getFullName(t)` combines `vorname` and `nachname` with fallback to `'-'`, matching the name-building pattern used in both existing pages.

4. **Loading state** -- Skeleton placeholders (header skeleton + 5 row skeletons), same as AnmeldungenPage.

5. **Error state** -- Destructive `Alert` with `AlertCircle` icon, error message, and "Erneut versuchen" retry button, identical pattern to both pages.

6. **Empty state** -- Card with centered text and a button to create the first entry.

7. **Desktop table** (hidden on mobile via `hidden md:block`) -- Columns: Name, E-Mail, Telefon, Geburtsdatum, Aktionen. Geburtsdatum formatted with `format(parseISO(...), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de })`.

8. **Mobile card list** (hidden on desktop via `md:hidden`) -- Shows participant name and email, with edit/delete action buttons.

9. **Create/Edit dialogs** -- `TeilnehmerDialog` component with fields:
   - `vorname` (text, required) and `nachname` (text, required) in a 2-column grid
   - `email` (type="email")
   - `telefon` (type="tel")
   - `geburtsdatum` (type="date")
   - Uses `useEffect` to populate fields on open (edit mode) or clear them (create mode)
   - Calls `createTeilnehmerEntry` or `updateTeilnehmerEntry` as appropriate

10. **Delete confirmation** -- `AlertDialog` with the message: `Teilnehmer "{vorname} {nachname}" wirklich löschen?` using `"` for proper HTML escaping, same pattern as existing pages.

11. **Toast notifications** -- Uses `sonner` toast for success/error messages on create, update, and delete operations.

12. **TypeScript compliance** -- Uses `import type` for the `Teilnehmer` type import, all field accesses are properly typed against the `Teilnehmer` interface.</result>

**File**: `/home/user/app/src/pages/DozentenPage.tsx`

The file follows the exact same patterns as the existing CRUD pages (`KursePage.tsx` and `AnmeldungenPage.tsx`). Here is a breakdown of what it contains:

### Export
- Named export `DozentenPage` (line 30) -- matches the pattern of `KursePage` and `AnmeldungenPage`.

### State Management
- `dozenten` state for the record list
- `loading`, `error` for async states
- `showCreate` for the create dialog
- `editRecord` / `deleteRecord` for edit and delete flows
- `deleting` for the delete confirmation button state

### Data Fetching
- `refreshData()` async function calls `LivingAppsService.getDozenten()`, wrapped in try/catch/finally with loading and error state management (lines 39-50)
- Triggered on mount via `useEffect` (line 52)

### Three UI States
1. **Loading skeleton** (lines 69-75): Shows a title skeleton and 5 row skeletons, matching the KursePage pattern.
2. **Error state** (lines 78-92): Shows the page title, a destructive `Alert` with `AlertCircle` icon, the error message, and a "Erneut versuchen" retry button.
3. **Empty state** (lines 105-113): A centered Card with a message and a button to create the first entry.

### Desktop Table (lines 116-155)
Hidden on mobile (`hidden md:block`). Columns:
- **Name** -- combines `vorname` and `nachname` with `.trim()`, falls back to `'-'`
- **E-Mail** -- `d.fields.email || '-'`
- **Telefon** -- `d.fields.telefon || '-'`
- **Fachgebiet** -- `d.fields.fachgebiet || '-'`
- **Aktionen** -- Edit (Pencil) and Delete (Trash2) icon buttons

### Mobile Card List (lines 157-183)
Shown only on mobile (`md:hidden`). Each card shows:
- Name (bold, `font-semibold`), falls back to `'Ohne Name'`
- Fachgebiet (conditionally shown as muted text)
- Edit and Delete icon buttons

### Create/Edit Dialogs (lines 187-201)
Both use the same `DozentDialog` component:
- Create: `open={showCreate}`, `record={null}`
- Edit: `open={!!editRecord}`, `record={editRecord}`

### Delete Confirmation (lines 203-219)
- Uses `AlertDialog` with the message: `Dozent "{vorname} {nachname}" wirklich löschen?`
- Shows "Löscht..." while deleting, with destructive styling on the action button
- On success, shows a toast and calls `refreshData()`

### DozentDialog Component (lines 224-327)
- Handles both create and edit modes via `isEditing = !!record`
- Fields reset on open via `useEffect` (lines 243-259)
- Form fields:
  - **Vorname** (text, `required`) and **Nachname** (text, `required`) in a 2-column grid
  - **E-Mail** (`type="email"`)
  - **Telefon** (`type="tel"`)
  - **Fachgebiet** (text)
- On submit: calls `createDozentenEntry` or `updateDozentenEntry`, shows success/error toasts
- Dialog footer: "Abbrechen" (outline) and submit button ("Erstellen" / "Speichern" / "Speichert...")

### Pattern Compliance
- Uses `import type` for the `Dozenten` type import (line 2)
- Uses `sonner` toast (line 27)
- Uses all required shadcn components: Card, Button, Input, Label, Dialog, AlertDialog, Skeleton, Alert
- Uses all required lucide-react icons: Plus, Pencil, Trash2, AlertCircle
- No TODOs or placeholders -- the file is complete</result>

**Export:** Named export `RaeumePage` (matching the pattern of `KursePage` and `AnmeldungenPage`).

**Structure (follows KursePage/AnmeldungenPage patterns exactly):**

1. **Imports:** Uses `import type` for the `Raeume` type-only import. All shadcn components (Card, Button, Input, Label, Dialog, AlertDialog, Skeleton, Alert), lucide-react icons (Plus, Pencil, Trash2, AlertCircle), and sonner toast are imported.

3. **`refreshData()`:** Calls `LivingAppsService.getRaeume()` with loading/error handling.

4. **Loading skeleton:** Renders a header skeleton + 5 row skeletons (same as KursePage).

5. **Error state:** Alert with `variant="destructive"`, AlertCircle icon, error message, and "Erneut versuchen" retry button.

6. **Empty state:** Card with centered text "Noch keine Raume vorhanden." and a "Ersten Raum erstellen" button.

7. **Desktop table** (`hidden md:block`): Columns for Raumname (font-medium), Gebäude (text-muted-foreground), Kapazität (text-right), and Aktionen (edit/delete icon buttons, right-aligned).

8. **Mobile card list** (`md:hidden`): Each card shows `raumname` as a bold title, `gebaeude` as muted subtitle, and `kapazitaet` as a small "Kapazität: N" line, with edit/delete buttons on the right.

9. **Create/Edit dialogs:** Both use the `RaumDialog` component. Fields:
   - `raumname` (text input, required with `required` attribute and `*` label marker)
   - `gebaeude` (text input, optional)
   - `kapazitaet` (number input, `min="0"`, optional)
   
   The dialog resets fields on open, pre-fills when editing, and handles submit with proper `submitting` state.

10. **Delete confirmation:** AlertDialog with the message `Raum "{raumname}" wirklich loschen?` using `"` for quotes (matching KursePage). Includes "Abbrechen" cancel and destructive-styled "Loschen" action button with loading state "Loscht...".

11. **Toast messages:**
    - Create success: `'Neuer Raum wurde erstellt.'`
    - Update success: `'Raum wurde aktualisiert.'`
    - Delete success: `'Raum "{raumname}" wurde geloscht.'`
    - Delete error: `'Fehler beim Loschen des Raums.'`
    - Submit error: `'Fehler: {message}'`</result>

content.text:
The Kursverwaltung dashboard has been designed, implemented, built, and deployed successfully. Here's a summary of what was delivered:

## Dashboard Summary

### Design (`design_brief.md`)
- **Theme:** Warm ivory background with deep teal accent (Plus Jakarta Sans font)
- **Layout:** Asymmetric hero section + chart/stats grid + upcoming courses table
- **Mobile:** Single column, bottom tab navigation (5 tabs + "Mehr" sheet)
- **Desktop:** Fixed sidebar (256px) with all 6 routes

### Implementation
- **6 routes** with React Router: `/`, `/kurse`, `/anmeldungen`, `/teilnehmer`, `/dozenten`, `/raeume`
- **Dashboard Overview** (`/`): Hero KPI (total registrations + payment progress bar), 4 secondary stats, bar chart (registrations per month), upcoming courses table
- **5 full CRUD pages** each with:
  - Desktop table + mobile card list views
  - Create dialog with form validation
  - Edit dialog (pre-filled)
  - Delete confirmation dialog
  - Toast notifications (success/error)
  - Loading skeletons, empty states, error states with retry

### Files Created/Modified
| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `design_brief.md` | Design specification |
| `src/index.css` | Updated CSS variables + font |
| `index.html` | Font link + German locale |
| `src/main.tsx` | BrowserRouter with basename |
| `src/App.tsx` | Routes definition |
| `src/components/Layout.tsx` | Sidebar + bottom tabs |
| `src/components/ui/sonner.tsx` | Fixed toast (removed next-themes) |
| `src/pages/DashboardOverview.tsx` | Overview with KPIs/chart |
| `src/pages/KursePage.tsx` | Courses CRUD |
| `src/pages/AnmeldungenPage.tsx` | Registrations CRUD |
| `src/pages/TeilnehmerPage.tsx` | Participants CRUD |
| `src/pages/DozentenPage.tsx` | Instructors CRUD |
| `src/pages/RaeumePage.tsx` | Rooms CRUD |

input.content:
# Memory Notes

## Project: Kursverwaltung Dashboard
- App group: Course Management (Kurse, Raeume, Dozenten, Anmeldungen, Teilnehmer)
- 5 apps with full CRUD, React Router navigation
- Uses Living Apps REST API with session cookies

## Key Learnings

### Build Issues
- `react-router-dom` was listed in package.json but not installed - needed `npm install`
- sonner.tsx component had `next-themes` import that doesn't exist in this project - replaced with hardcoded "light" theme
- Vite build uses path aliases (`@/`) that tsc CLI doesn't resolve; use `npm run build` for validation

### API Rules (Critical)
- Dates: `date/date` = `YYYY-MM-DD`, `date/datetimeminute` = `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` (NO seconds)
- applookup fields: ALWAYS use `extractRecordId()`, never manual URL parsing
- API returns objects not arrays: use `Object.entries()` to get record_id from keys
- SelectItem value="" causes runtime errors - use "none" sentinel value

### Design Skill
- Font must NOT be Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, Arial, Helvetica, system-ui
- Colors must be complete `hsl()` functions, not raw values
- CSS uses Tailwind v4 with `@theme inline` block mapping CSS vars to Tailwind tokens
- Light mode only (no .dark class on html)

### Patterns
- CRUD dialogs: single component for create+edit (null record = create, record = edit)
- Delete always needs AlertDialog confirmation
- Toast via `sonner` directly (`import { toast } from 'sonner'`)
- Data refresh: call refreshData() after any mutation
- Type imports: must use `import type { ... }` for TypeScript verbatimModuleSyntax

### API Rules (Critical)
- Dates: `date/date` = `YYYY-MM-DD`, `date/datetimeminute` = `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` (NO seconds)

- API returns objects not arrays: use `Object.entries()` to get record_id from keys

- Font must NOT be Inter, Roboto, Open Sans, Lato, Arial, Helvetica, system-ui

- CRUD dialogs: single component for create+edit (null record = create, record = edit)
